text: Racławice is a village located in Lesser Poland Voivodeship in southern Poland. It became famous after the victorious Battle of Racławice (1794) in the Kościuszko Uprising. It is the seat of a municipality (Gmina Racławice) within Miechów County. It lies approximately east of Miechów and north-east of the regional capital Kraków. The battle site is one of Poland's official national Historic Monuments (Pomnik historii), as designated May 1, 2004. Its listing is maintained by the National Heritage Board of Poland. ==See also== * Racławice Panorama Category:Villages in Miechów County Category:Kielce Governorate Category:Kielce Voivodeship (1919–1939)
title: Racławice
